greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: First trisection of A022998.
comment: Read modulo 10, this yields a sequence with a period of length 10 containing all 10 digits: 0, 3, 2, 9, 4, 5, 6, 1, 8, 7.

The Pisano period lengths for reading the sequence modulo m>=1 are 1,  2,  1,  4, 10,  2, 14,  8,  6, 10, 22,  4, 26, 14, 10, 16, 34,  6, 38, 20, 14, 22, 46,  8, 50, 26, 18, 28, 58... - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 08 2011
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..5000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,0,-1).
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(n=3*n); if (n % 2, n, 2*n); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 21 2016
results.author: _Paul Curtz_, Oct 03 2009
